ygData.subject: Re: [Re: Market in EQ]
ygData.msgSnippet: XxKommiexX@aol.com wrote: From: XxKommiexX@aol.com It would make people too mad. Having a nice piece of magic armor that took forever to get disappear because
ygData.messageBody:
XxKommiexX@... wrote:
From: XxKommiexX@...

It would make people too mad. Having a nice piece of magic armor that took
forever to get disappear because it wore out. I don't like this idea, as it
would just make EQ more like Diablo and Ultima Online, which I hope they
would want to try and stay away from.

------------------------------------------

Some other RPG's I've played made it so that common wear items wore quicker
than others as well as making rare quest items not wear very little or not at
all since they are supposed to be considered priceless. I think the idea of
making items wear would be a great thing for the trade. A shield and sword
would wear quicker than say boots or leggings. This gives smiths an
oppurtunity to increase their skills with less cost if they want to work on
repairing and improving items.

Cerran
